    57‚Üí  // FIXED: Added insights field for QA compatibility
    58‚Üí  insights?: string;
    59‚Üí  confidence: number;
    60‚Üí  processingTime: number;
    61‚Üí}
    62‚Üí
    63‚Üíexport class SemanticAnalysisAgent {
    64‚Üí  private anthropicClient: Anthropic | null = null;
    65‚Üí  private openaiClient: OpenAI | null = null;
    66‚Üí  private repositoryPath: string;
    67‚Üí
    68‚Üí  constructor(repositoryPath: string = '.') {
    69‚Üí    this.repositoryPath = repositoryPath;
    70‚Üí    this.initializeClients();
    71‚Üí  }
    72‚Üí
    73‚Üí  async analyzeGitAndVibeData(
    74‚Üí    gitAnalysis: any,
    75‚Üí    vibeAnalysis: any,
    76‚Üí    options: {
    77‚Üí      maxFiles?: number;
    78‚Üí      includePatterns?: string[];
    79‚Üí      excludePatterns?: string[];
    80‚Üí      analysisDepth?: 'surface' | 'deep' | 'comprehensive';
    81‚Üí    } = {}
    82‚Üí  ): Promise<SemanticAnalysisResult> {
    83‚Üí    const startTime = Date.now();
    84‚Üí    
    85‚Üí    log('Starting comprehensive semantic analysis', 'info', {
    86‚Üí      gitCommits: gitAnalysis?.commits?.length || 0,
    87‚Üí      vibeSessions: vibeAnalysis?.sessions?.length || 0,
    88‚Üí      analysisDepth: options.analysisDepth || 'deep'
    89‚Üí    });
    90‚Üí
    91‚Üí    try {
    92‚Üí      // Extract files to analyze from git history
    93‚Üí      const filesToAnalyze = this.extractFilesFromGitHistory(gitAnalysis, options);
    94‚Üí      log(`Identified ${filesToAnalyze.length} files for analysis`, 'info');
    95‚Üí
    96‚Üí      // Perform deep code analysis
    97‚Üí      const codeFiles = await this.analyzeCodeFiles(filesToAnalyze, options);
    98‚Üí      
    99‚Üí      // Generate code analysis metrics
   100‚Üí      const codeAnalysis = this.generateCodeAnalysisMetrics(codeFiles);
   101‚Üí
   102‚Üí      // Perform cross-analysis correlation
   103‚Üí      const crossAnalysisInsights = await this.performCrossAnalysis(
   104‚Üí        codeFiles, gitAnalysis, vibeAnalysis
   105‚Üí      );
   106‚Üí
   107‚Üí      // Generate semantic insights using LLM
   108‚Üí      const semanticInsights = await this.generateSemanticInsights(
   109‚Üí        codeFiles, gitAnalysis, vibeAnalysis, crossAnalysisInsights
   110‚Üí      );
   111‚Üí
   112‚Üí      const processingTime = Date.now() - startTime;
   113‚Üí      
   114‚Üí      // FIXED: Create aggregated insights for QA validation
   115‚Üí      const aggregatedInsights = [
   116‚Üí        ...semanticInsights.keyPatterns,
   117‚Üí        ...semanticInsights.learnings,
   118‚Üí        ...semanticInsights.architecturalDecisions
   119‚Üí      ].filter(Boolean).join('. ');
   120‚Üí      
   121‚Üí      const result: SemanticAnalysisResult = {
   122‚Üí        codeAnalysis,
   123‚Üí        crossAnalysisInsights,
   124‚Üí        semanticInsights,
   125‚Üí        insights: aggregatedInsights || 'No specific insights extracted from semantic analysis.',
   126‚Üí        confidence: this.calculateConfidence(codeFiles, crossAnalysisInsights),
   127‚Üí        processingTime
   128‚Üí      };
   129‚Üí
   130‚Üí      log('Semantic analysis completed', 'info', {
   131‚Üí        filesAnalyzed: codeFiles.length,
   132‚Üí        patternsFound: semanticInsights.keyPatterns.length,
   133‚Üí        confidence: result.confidence,
   134‚Üí        processingTime,
   135‚Üí        hasInsightsField: 'insights' in result,
   136‚Üí        insightsLength: result.insights ? result.insights.length : 0
   137‚Üí      });
   138‚Üí
   139‚Üí      return result;
   140‚Üí
   141‚Üí    } catch (error) {
   142‚Üí      log('Semantic analysis failed', 'error', error);
   143‚Üí      throw error;
   144‚Üí    }
   145‚Üí  }
   146‚Üí
   147‚Üí  private initializeClients(): void {
   148‚Üí    // Initialize Anthropic client
   149‚Üí    const anthropicKey = process.env.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY;
   150‚Üí    if (anthropicKey && anthropicKey !== "your-anthropic-api-key") {
   151‚Üí      this.anthropicClient = new Anthropic({
   152‚Üí        apiKey: anthropicKey,
   153‚Üí      });
   154‚Üí      log("Anthropic client initialized for semantic analysis", "info");
   155‚Üí    }
   156‚Üí
   157‚Üí    // Initialize OpenAI client
   158‚Üí    const openaiKey = process.env.OPENAI_API_KEY;
   159‚Üí    if (openaiKey && openaiKey !== "your-openai-api-key") {
   160‚Üí      this.openaiClient = new OpenAI({
   161‚Üí        apiKey: openaiKey,
   162‚Üí      });
   163‚Üí      log("OpenAI client initialized for semantic analysis", "info");
   164‚Üí    }
   165‚Üí
   166‚Üí    if (!this.anthropicClient && !this.openaiClient) {
   167‚Üí      log("No LLM clients available for semantic analysis", "warning");
   168‚Üí    }
   169‚Üí  }
   170‚Üí
   171‚Üí  private extractFilesFromGitHistory(
   172‚Üí    gitAnalysis: any, 
   173‚Üí    options: { maxFiles?: number; includePatterns?: string[]; excludePatterns?: string[] }
   174‚Üí  ): string[] {
   175‚Üí    const {
   176‚Üí      maxFiles = 50,
   177‚Üí      includePatterns = ['**/*.ts', '**/*.js', '**/*.json', '**/*.md'],
   178‚Üí      excludePatterns = ['node_modules/**', 'dist/**', '.git/**', '**/*.log']
   179‚Üí    } = options;
   180‚Üí
   181‚Üí    const filesSet = new Set<string>();
   182‚Üí
   183‚Üí    // Extract files from commits
   184‚Üí    if (gitAnalysis?.commits) {
   185‚Üí      gitAnalysis.commits.forEach((commit: any) => {
   186‚Üí        if (commit.files) {
   187‚Üí          commit.files.forEach((file: any) => {
   188‚Üí            if (this.shouldIncludeFile(file.path, includePatterns, excludePatterns)) {
   189‚Üí              filesSet.add(file.path);
   190‚Üí            }
   191‚Üí          });
   192‚Üí        }
   193‚Üí      });
   194‚Üí    }
   195‚Üí
   196‚Üí    // Extract files from architectural decisions
   197‚Üí    if (gitAnalysis?.architecturalDecisions) {
   198‚Üí      gitAnalysis.architecturalDecisions.forEach((decision: any) => {
   199‚Üí        if (decision.files) {
   200‚Üí          decision.files.forEach((filePath: string) => {
   201‚Üí            if (this.shouldIncludeFile(filePath, includePatterns, excludePatterns)) {
   202‚Üí              filesSet.add(filePath);
   203‚Üí            }
   204‚Üí          });
   205‚Üí        }
   206‚Üí      });
   207‚Üí    }
   208‚Üí
   209‚Üí    // Convert to array and limit
   210‚Üí    const files = Array.from(filesSet).slice(0, maxFiles);
   211‚Üí    
   212‚Üí    log(`File extraction: ${filesSet.size} unique files found, analyzing top ${files.length}`, 'info');
   213‚Üí    return files;
   214‚Üí  }
   215‚Üí
   216‚Üí  private shouldIncludeFile(
   217‚Üí    filePath: string, 
   218‚Üí    includePatterns: string[], 
   219‚Üí    excludePatterns: string[]
   220‚Üí  ): boolean {
   221‚Üí    // Check exclude patterns first
   222‚Üí    for (const pattern of excludePatterns) {
   223‚Üí      const regex = new RegExp(pattern.replace(/\*\*/g, '.*').replace(/\*/g, '[^/]*'));
   224‚Üí      if (regex.test(filePath)) {
   225‚Üí        return false;
   226‚Üí      }
   227‚Üí    }
   228‚Üí
   229‚Üí    // Check include patterns
   230‚Üí    for (const pattern of includePatterns) {
   231‚Üí      const regex = new RegExp(pattern.replace(/\*\*/g, '.*').replace(/\*/g, '[^/]*'));
   232‚Üí      if (regex.test(filePath)) {
   233‚Üí        return true;
   234‚Üí      }
   235‚Üí    }
   236‚Üí
   237‚Üí    return false;
   238‚Üí  }
   239‚Üí
   240‚Üí  private async analyzeCodeFiles(
   241‚Üí    filePaths: string[], 
   242‚Üí    options: { analysisDepth?: string }
   243‚Üí  ): Promise<CodeFile[]> {
   244‚Üí    const codeFiles: CodeFile[] = [];
   245‚Üí    const depth = options.analysisDepth || 'deep';
   246‚Üí
   247‚Üí    for (const filePath of filePaths) {
   248‚Üí      try {
   249‚Üí        const fullPath = path.join(this.repositoryPath, filePath);
   250‚Üí        
   251‚Üí        if (!fs.existsSync(fullPath)) {
   252‚Üí          log(`File not found: ${filePath}`, 'warning');
   253‚Üí          continue;
   254‚Üí        }
   255‚Üí
   256‚Üí        const stats = fs.statSync(fullPath);
   257‚Üí        if (stats.size > 1024 * 1024) { // Skip files > 1MB
   258‚Üí          log(`Skipping large file: ${filePath} (${stats.size} bytes)`, 'info');
   259‚Üí          continue;
   260‚Üí        }
   261‚Üí
   262‚Üí        const content = fs.readFileSync(fullPath, 'utf8');
   263‚Üí        const language = this.detectLanguage(filePath);
   264‚Üí
   265‚Üí        const codeFile: CodeFile = {
   266‚Üí          path: filePath,
   267‚Üí          content,
   268‚Üí          language,
   269‚Üí          size: content.length,
   270‚Üí          complexity: this.calculateComplexity(content, language),
   271‚Üí          patterns: this.detectCodePatterns(content, language),
   272‚Üí          functions: this.extractFunctions(content, language),
   273‚Üí          imports: this.extractImports(content, language),
   274‚Üí          changeType: 'modified' // Default, could be enhanced with git diff analysis
   275‚Üí        };
   276‚Üí
   277‚Üí        codeFiles.push(codeFile);
   278‚Üí
   279‚Üí      } catch (error) {
   280‚Üí        log(`Error analyzing file ${filePath}`, 'warning', error);
   281‚Üí      }
   282‚Üí    }
   283‚Üí
   284‚Üí    log(`Code analysis completed: ${codeFiles.length} files processed`, 'info');
   285‚Üí    return codeFiles;
   286‚Üí  }
   287‚Üí
   288‚Üí  private detectLanguage(filePath: string): string {
   289‚Üí    const ext = path.extname(filePath).toLowerCase();
   290‚Üí    const languageMap: Record<string, string> = {
   291‚Üí      '.ts': 'typescript',
   292‚Üí      '.js': 'javascript',
   293‚Üí      '.jsx': 'javascript',
   294‚Üí      '.tsx': 'typescript',
   295‚Üí      '.json': 'json',
   296‚Üí      '.md': 'markdown',
   297‚Üí      '.py': 'python',
   298‚Üí      '.java': 'java',
   299‚Üí      '.cpp': 'cpp',
   300‚Üí      '.c': 'c',
   301‚Üí      '.go': 'go',
   302‚Üí      '.rs': 'rust',
   303‚Üí      '.php': 'php',
   304‚Üí      '.rb': 'ruby',
   305‚Üí      '.yml': 'yaml',
   306‚Üí      '.yaml': 'yaml'
   307‚Üí    };
   308‚Üí
   309‚Üí    return languageMap[ext] || 'text';
   310‚Üí  }
   311‚Üí
   312‚Üí  private calculateComplexity(content: string, language: string): number {
   313‚Üí    // Simple cyclomatic complexity estimation
   314‚Üí    let complexity = 1; // Base complexity
   315‚Üí
   316‚Üí    // Count decision points based on language
   317‚Üí    const patterns = {
   318‚Üí      typescript: /\b(if|else|while|for|switch|case|catch|&&|\|\||\?)\b/g,
   319‚Üí      javascript: /\b(if|else|while|for|switch|case|catch|&&|\|\||\?)\b/g,
   320‚Üí      python: /\b(if|elif|else|while|for|try|except|and|or)\b/g,
   321‚Üí      java: /\b(if|else|while|for|switch|case|catch|&&|\|\||\?)\b/g
   322‚Üí    };
   323‚Üí
   324‚Üí    const pattern = patterns[language as keyof typeof patterns] || patterns.javascript;
   325‚Üí    const matches = content.match(pattern);
   326‚Üí    
   327‚Üí    if (matches) {
   328‚Üí      complexity += matches.length;
   329‚Üí    }
   330‚Üí
   331‚Üí    return Math.min(complexity, 50); // Cap at 50 for sanity
   332‚Üí  }
   333‚Üí
   334‚Üí  private detectCodePatterns(content: string, language: string): string[] {
   335‚Üí    const patterns: string[] = [];
   336‚Üí
   337‚Üí    // Common architectural patterns
   338‚Üí    const patternMatches = [
   339‚Üí      { pattern: 'singleton', regex: /class\s+\w+\s*{[\s\S]*?private\s+static\s+instance/i },
   340‚Üí      { pattern: 'factory', regex: /create\w*\s*\([^)]*\)[\s\S]*?return\s+new/i },
   341‚Üí      { pattern: 'observer', regex: /(addEventListener|subscribe|notify|Observer)/i },
   342‚Üí      { pattern: 'promise', regex: /(Promise|async|await)/i },
   343‚Üí      { pattern: 'decorator', regex: /@\w+/g },
   344‚Üí      { pattern: 'middleware', regex: /(middleware|next\(\)|express)/i },
   345‚Üí      { pattern: 'repository', regex: /Repository|DataAccess/i },
   346‚Üí      { pattern: 'service', regex: /Service|Provider/i },
   347‚Üí      { pattern: 'component', regex: /(React\.|Component|useState|useEffect)/i },
   348‚Üí      { pattern: 'api', regex: /(fetch|axios|http|api)/i }
   349‚Üí    ];
   350‚Üí
   351‚Üí    for (const { pattern, regex } of patternMatches) {
   352‚Üí      if (regex.test(content)) {
   353‚Üí        patterns.push(pattern);
   354‚Üí      }
   355‚Üí    }
   356‚Üí
   357‚Üí    return patterns;
   358‚Üí  }
   359‚Üí
   360‚Üí  private extractFunctions(content: string, language: string): string[] {
   361‚Üí    const functions: string[] = [];
   362‚Üí
   363‚Üí    // Language-specific function extraction
   364‚Üí    let functionRegex: RegExp;
   365‚Üí
   366‚Üí    switch (language) {
   367‚Üí      case 'typescript':
   368‚Üí      case 'javascript':
   369‚Üí        functionRegex = /(?:function\s+(\w+)|(\w+)\s*\([^)]*\)\s*(?:=>|\{)|(?:async\s+)?(\w+)\s*\([^)]*\)\s*(?:=>|\{))/g;
   370‚Üí        break;
   371‚Üí      case 'python':
   372‚Üí        functionRegex = /def\s+(\w+)\s*\(/g;
   373‚Üí        break;
   374‚Üí      case 'java':
   375‚Üí        functionRegex = /(?:public|private|protected)?\s*(?:static)?\s*\w+\s+(\w+)\s*\(/g;
   376‚Üí        break;
   377‚Üí      default:
   378‚Üí        functionRegex = /function\s+(\w+)|(\w+)\s*\(/g;
   379‚Üí    }
   380‚Üí
   381‚Üí    let match;
   382‚Üí    while ((match = functionRegex.exec(content)) !== null) {
   383‚Üí      const functionName = match[1] || match[2] || match[3];
   384‚Üí      if (functionName && functionName !== 'if' && functionName !== 'for') {
   385‚Üí        functions.push(functionName);
   386‚Üí      }
   387‚Üí    }
   388‚Üí
   389‚Üí    return [...new Set(functions)]; // Remove duplicates
   390‚Üí  }
   391‚Üí
   392‚Üí  private extractImports(content: string, language: string): string[] {
   393‚Üí    const imports: string[] = [];
   394‚Üí
   395‚Üí    // Language-specific import extraction
   396‚Üí    let importRegex: RegExp;
   397‚Üí
   398‚Üí    switch (language) {
   399‚Üí      case 'typescript':
   400‚Üí      case 'javascript':
   401‚Üí        importRegex = /import\s+(?:.*?\s+from\s+)?['"`]([^'"`]+)['"`]/g;
   402‚Üí        break;
   403‚Üí      case 'python':
   404‚Üí        importRegex = /(?:from\s+(\S+)\s+import|import\s+([^;\n]+))/g;
   405‚Üí        break;
   406‚Üí      case 'java':
   407‚Üí        importRegex = /import\s+([^;\n]+);/g;
   408‚Üí        break;
   409‚Üí      default:
   410‚Üí        importRegex = /import\s+['"`]([^'"`]+)['"`]/g;
   411‚Üí    }
   412‚Üí
   413‚Üí    let match;
   414‚Üí    while ((match = importRegex.exec(content)) !== null) {
   415‚Üí      const importPath = match[1] || match[2];
   416‚Üí      if (importPath) {
   417‚Üí        imports.push(importPath.trim());
   418‚Üí      }
   419‚Üí    }
   420‚Üí
   421‚Üí    return [...new Set(imports)]; // Remove duplicates
   422‚Üí  }
   423‚Üí
   424‚Üí  private generateCodeAnalysisMetrics(codeFiles: CodeFile[]): SemanticAnalysisResult['codeAnalysis'] {
   425‚Üí    const totalLinesOfCode = codeFiles.reduce((sum, file) => 
   426‚Üí      sum + file.content.split('\n').length, 0
   427‚Üí    );
   428‚Üí
   429‚Üí    // Language distribution
   430‚Üí    const languageDistribution: Record<string, number> = {};
   431‚Üí    codeFiles.forEach(file => {
   432‚Üí      languageDistribution[file.language] = (languageDistribution[file.language] || 0) + 1;
   433‚Üí    });
   434‚Üí
   435‚Üí    // Complexity metrics
   436‚Üí    const complexities = codeFiles.map(f => f.complexity);
   437‚Üí    const averageComplexity = complexities.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0) / complexities.length;
   438‚Üí    const highComplexityFiles = codeFiles
   439‚Üí      .filter(f => f.complexity > 10)
   440‚Üí      .map(f => f.path);
   441‚Üí    const totalFunctions = codeFiles.reduce((sum, f) => sum + f.functions.length, 0);
   442‚Üí
   443‚Üí    // Architectural patterns
   444‚Üí    const patternCounts = new Map<string, { files: string[]; count: number }>();
   445‚Üí    codeFiles.forEach(file => {
   446‚Üí      file.patterns.forEach(pattern => {
   447‚Üí        if (!patternCounts.has(pattern)) {
   448‚Üí          patternCounts.set(pattern, { files: [], count: 0 });
   449‚Üí        }
   450‚Üí        const data = patternCounts.get(pattern)!;
   451‚Üí        data.files.push(file.path);
   452‚Üí        data.count++;
   453‚Üí      });
   454‚Üí    });
   455‚Üí
   456‚Üí    const architecturalPatterns = Array.from(patternCounts.entries())
   457‚Üí      .map(([name, data]) => ({
   458‚Üí        name,
   459‚Üí        files: data.files,
   460‚Üí        description: this.getPatternDescription(name),
   461‚Üí        confidence: Math.min(data.count / codeFiles.length, 1)
   462‚Üí      }))
   463‚Üí      .sort((a, b) => b.confidence - a.confidence);
   464‚Üí
   465‚Üí    // Code <USER_ID_REDACTED> assessment
   466‚Üí    const codeQuality = this.assessCodeQuality(codeFiles);
   467‚Üí
   468‚Üí    return {
   469‚Üí      filesAnalyzed: codeFiles.length,
   470‚Üí      totalLinesOfCode,
   471‚Üí      languageDistribution,
   472‚Üí      complexityMetrics: {
   473‚Üí        averageComplexity: Math.round(averageComplexity * 100) / 100,
   474‚Üí        highComplexityFiles,
   475‚Üí        totalFunctions
   476‚Üí      },
   477‚Üí      architecturalPatterns,
   478‚Üí      codeQuality
   479‚Üí    };
   480‚Üí  }
   481‚Üí
   482‚Üí  private getPatternDescription(pattern: string): string {
   483‚Üí    const descriptions: Record<string, string> = {
   484‚Üí      singleton: 'Ensures a class has only one instance',
   485‚Üí      factory: 'Creates objects without specifying exact classes',
   486‚Üí      observer: 'Defines one-to-many dependency between objects',
   487‚Üí      promise: 'Handles asynchronous operations',
   488‚Üí      decorator: 'Adds behavior to objects dynamically',
   489‚Üí      middleware: 'Processes requests in a pipeline',
   490‚Üí      repository: 'Encapsulates data access logic',
   491‚Üí      service: 'Contains business logic',
   492‚Üí      component: 'Reusable UI building blocks',
   493‚Üí      api: 'Handles external communication'
   494‚Üí    };
   495‚Üí
   496‚Üí    return descriptions[pattern] || `${pattern} pattern implementation`;
   497‚Üí  }
   498‚Üí
   499‚Üí  private assessCodeQuality(codeFiles: CodeFile[]): { score: number; issues: string[]; recommendations: string[] } {
   500‚Üí    const issues: string[] = [];
   501‚Üí    const recommendations: string[] = [];
   502‚Üí    let score = 100;
   503‚Üí
   504‚Üí    // Check for high complexity
   505‚Üí    const highComplexityCount = codeFiles.filter(f => f.complexity > 15).length;
   506‚Üí    if (highComplexityCount > 0) {
   507‚Üí      issues.push(`${highComplexityCount} files have high complexity (>15)`);
   508‚Üí      recommendations.push('Consider refactoring complex functions into smaller ones');
   509‚Üí      score -= highComplexityCount * 5;
   510‚Üí    }
   511‚Üí
   512‚Üí    // Check for large files
   513‚Üí    const largeFiles = codeFiles.filter(f => f.content.split('\n').length > 500);
   514‚Üí    if (largeFiles.length > 0) {
   515‚Üí      issues.push(`${largeFiles.length} files exceed 500 lines`);
   516‚Üí      recommendations.push('Break down large files into smaller, focused modules');
   517‚Üí      score -= largeFiles.length * 3;
   518‚Üí    }
   519‚Üí
   520‚Üí    // Check for missing patterns
   521‚Üí    const hasServices = codeFiles.some(f => f.patterns.includes('service'));
   522‚Üí    const hasComponents = codeFiles.some(f => f.patterns.includes('component'));
   523‚Üí    if (!hasServices && codeFiles.length > 5) {
   524‚Üí      recommendations.push('Consider implementing service layer for better separation of concerns');
   525‚Üí    }
   526‚Üí
   527‚Üí    return {
   528‚Üí      score: Math.max(0, score),
   529‚Üí      issues,
   530‚Üí      recommendations
   531‚Üí    };
   532‚Üí  }
   533‚Üí
   534‚Üí  private async performCrossAnalysis(
   535‚Üí    codeFiles: CodeFile[],
   536‚Üí    gitAnalysis: any,
   537‚Üí    vibeAnalysis: any
   538‚Üí  ): Promise<SemanticAnalysisResult['crossAnalysisInsights']> {
   539‚Üí    const gitCodeCorrelation: string[] = [];
   540‚Üí    const vibeCodeCorrelation: string[] = [];
   541‚Üí    const conversationImplementationMap: any[] = [];
   542‚Üí
   543‚Üí    // Correlate git patterns with code patterns
   544‚Üí    if (gitAnalysis?.codeEvolution) {
   545‚Üí      gitAnalysis.codeEvolution.forEach((pattern: any) => {
   546‚Üí        const relatedFiles = codeFiles.filter(file => 
   547‚Üí          pattern.files.some((gitFile: any) => {
   548‚Üí            const fileName = typeof gitFile === 'string' ? gitFile : String(gitFile);
   549‚Üí            return file.path.includes(fileName);
   550‚Üí          })
   551‚Üí        );
   552‚Üí        if (relatedFiles.length > 0) {
   553‚Üí          const codePatterns = [...new Set(relatedFiles.flatMap(f => f.patterns))];
   554‚Üí          gitCodeCorrelation.push(
   555‚Üí            `Git pattern "${pattern.pattern}" correlates with code patterns: ${codePatterns.join(', ')}`
   556‚Üí          );
   557‚Üí        }
   558‚Üí      });
   559‚Üí    }
   560‚Üí
   561‚Üí    // Correlate conversation themes with code implementation
   562‚Üí    if (vibeAnalysis?.problemSolutionPairs) {
   563‚Üí      vibeAnalysis.problemSolutionPairs.forEach((pair: any) => {
   564‚Üí        const implementationFiles = codeFiles.filter(file =>
   565‚Üí          pair.solution.technologies.some((tech: string) => 
   566‚Üí            file.language.toLowerCase().includes(tech.toLowerCase()) ||
   567‚Üí            file.content.toLowerCase().includes(tech.toLowerCase())
   568‚Üí          )
   569‚Üí        );
   570‚Üí
   571‚Üí        if (implementationFiles.length > 0) {
   572‚Üí          conversationImplementationMap.push({
   573‚Üí            problem: pair.problem.description.substring(0, 100) + '...',
   574‚Üí            implementation: implementationFiles.flatMap(f => f.patterns),
   575‚Üí            files: implementationFiles.map(f => f.path)
   576‚Üí          });
   577‚Üí
   578‚Üí          vibeCodeCorrelation.push(
   579‚Üí            `Problem "${pair.problem.description.substring(0, 50)}..." implemented using ${implementationFiles.map(f => f.language).join(', ')}`
   580‚Üí          );
   581‚Üí        }
   582‚Üí      });
   583‚Üí    }
   584‚Üí
   585‚Üí    return {
   586‚Üí      gitCodeCorrelation,
   587‚Üí      vibeCodeCorrelation,
   588‚Üí      conversationImplementationMap
   589‚Üí    };
   590‚Üí  }
   591‚Üí
   592‚Üí  private async generateSemanticInsights(
   593‚Üí    codeFiles: CodeFile[],
   594‚Üí    gitAnalysis: any,
   595‚Üí    vibeAnalysis: any,
   596‚Üí    crossAnalysis: any
   597‚Üí  ): Promise<SemanticAnalysisResult['semanticInsights']> {
   598‚Üí    // Generate insights using LLM if available
   599‚Üí    if (this.anthropicClient || this.openaiClient) {
   600‚Üí      return await this.generateLLMInsights(codeFiles, gitAnalysis, vibeAnalysis, crossAnalysis);
   601‚Üí    }
   602‚Üí
   603‚Üí    // Fallback to rule-based insights
   604‚Üí    return this.generateRuleBasedInsights(codeFiles, gitAnalysis, vibeAnalysis, crossAnalysis);
   605‚Üí  }
   606‚Üí
   607‚Üí  private async generateLLMInsights(
   608‚Üí    codeFiles: CodeFile[],
   609‚Üí    gitAnalysis: any,
   610‚Üí    vibeAnalysis: any,
   611‚Üí    crossAnalysis: any
   612‚Üí  ): Promise<SemanticAnalysisResult['semanticInsights']> {
   613‚Üí    try {
   614‚Üí      const analysisPrompt = this.buildAnalysisPrompt(codeFiles, gitAnalysis, vibeAnalysis, crossAnalysis);
   615‚Üí      
   616‚Üí      let response: string;
   617‚Üí      
   618‚Üí      // Try Anthropic first with rate limit handling
   619‚Üí      if (this.anthropicClient) {
   620‚Üí        try {
   621‚Üí          response = await this.callAnthropicWithRetry(analysisPrompt);
   622‚Üí        } catch (anthropicError: any) {
   623‚Üí          log('Anthropic call failed, trying OpenAI fallback', 'warning', {
   624‚Üí            error: anthropicError.message,
   625‚Üí            status: anthropicError.status
   626‚Üí          });
   627‚Üí          
   628‚Üí          // If Anthropic fails due to rate limiting, try OpenAI
   629‚Üí          if (this.openaiClient && this.isRateLimitError(anthropicError)) {
   630‚Üí            response = await this.callOpenAIWithRetry(analysisPrompt);
   631‚Üí          } else {
   632‚Üí            throw anthropicError;
   633‚Üí          }
   634‚Üí        }
   635‚Üí      } else if (this.openaiClient) {
   636‚Üí        response = await this.callOpenAIWithRetry(analysisPrompt);
   637‚Üí      } else {
   638‚Üí        throw new Error('No LLM client available');
   639‚Üí      }
   640‚Üí
   641‚Üí      return this.parseInsightsFromLLMResponse(response);
   642‚Üí
   643‚Üí    } catch (error) {
   644‚Üí      log('LLM insight generation failed, falling back to rule-based', 'warning', error);
   645‚Üí      return this.generateRuleBasedInsights(codeFiles, gitAnalysis, vibeAnalysis, crossAnalysis);
   646‚Üí    }
   647‚Üí  }
   648‚Üí
   649‚Üí  /**
   650‚Üí   * Check if an error is a rate limit error
   651‚Üí   */
   652‚Üí  private isRateLimitError(error: any): boolean {
   653‚Üí    return error.status === 429 || 
   654‚Üí           error.message?.includes('rate_limit') ||
   655‚Üí           error.message?.includes('Rate limit') ||
   656‚Üí           error.error?.error?.type === 'rate_limit_error';
   657‚Üí  }
   658‚Üí
   659‚Üí  /**
   660‚Üí   * Sleep for a given number of milliseconds
   661‚Üí   */
   662‚Üí  private async sleep(ms: number): Promise<void> {
   663‚Üí    return new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, ms));
   664‚Üí  }
   665‚Üí
   666‚Üí  /**
   667‚Üí   * Call Anthropic with exponential backoff retry
   668‚Üí   */
   669‚Üí  private async callAnthropicWithRetry(prompt: string, maxRetries: number = 3): Promise<string> {
   670‚Üí    let lastError: any;
   671‚Üí    
   672‚Üí    for (let attempt = 0; attempt < maxRetries; attempt++) {
   673‚Üí      try {
   674‚Üí        log(`Calling Anthropic API (attempt ${attempt + 1}/${maxRetries})`, 'info');
   675‚Üí        
   676‚Üí        const result = await this.anthropicClient!.messages.create({
   677‚Üí          model: "claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022",
   678‚Üí          max_tokens: 2000,
   679‚Üí          messages: [{ role: "user", content: prompt }]
   680‚Üí        });
   681‚Üí        
   682‚Üí        const response = result.content[0].type === 'text' ? result.content[0].text : '';
   683‚Üí        log(`Anthropic API call successful`, 'info', {
   684‚Üí          responseLength: response.length,
   685‚Üí          attempt: attempt + 1
   686‚Üí        });
   687‚Üí        
   688‚Üí        return response;
   689‚Üí        
   690‚Üí      } catch (error: any) {
   691‚Üí        lastError = error;
   692‚Üí        
   693‚Üí        if (this.isRateLimitError(error)) {
   694‚Üí          const backoffMs = Math.min(1000 * Math.pow(2, attempt), 30000); // Max 30 seconds
   695‚Üí          log(`Rate limited, retrying in ${backoffMs}ms`, 'warning', {
   696‚Üí            attempt: attempt + 1,
   697‚Üí            maxRetries,
   698‚Üí            status: error.status,
   699‚Üí            backoffMs
   700‚Üí          });
   701‚Üí          
   702‚Üí          if (attempt < maxRetries - 1) {
   703‚Üí            await this.sleep(backoffMs);
   704‚Üí            continue;
   705‚Üí          }
   706‚Üí        }
   707‚Üí        
   708‚Üí        // For non-rate-limit errors, don't retry
   709‚Üí        log(`Anthropic API call failed`, 'error', {
   710‚Üí          attempt: attempt + 1,
   711‚Üí          error: error.message,
   712‚Üí          status: error.status
   713‚Üí        });
   714‚Üí        break;
   715‚Üí      }
   716‚Üí    }
   717‚Üí    
   718‚Üí    throw lastError;
   719‚Üí  }
   720‚Üí
   721‚Üí  /**
   722‚Üí   * Call OpenAI with exponential backoff retry
   723‚Üí   */
   724‚Üí  private async callOpenAIWithRetry(prompt: string, maxRetries: number = 3): Promise<string> {
   725‚Üí    let lastError: any;
   726‚Üí    
   727‚Üí    for (let attempt = 0; attempt < maxRetries; attempt++) {
   728‚Üí      try {
   729‚Üí        log(`Calling OpenAI API (attempt ${attempt + 1}/${maxRetries})`, 'info');
   730‚Üí        
   731‚Üí        const result = await this.openaiClient!.chat.completions.create({
   732‚Üí          model: "gpt-4",
   733‚Üí          max_tokens: 2000,
   734‚Üí          messages: [{ role: "user", content: prompt }]
   735‚Üí        });
   736‚Üí        
   737‚Üí        const response = result.choices[0]?.message?.content || '';
   738‚Üí        log(`OpenAI API call successful`, 'info', {
   739‚Üí          responseLength: response.length,
   740‚Üí          attempt: attempt + 1
   741‚Üí        });
   742‚Üí        
   743‚Üí        return response;
   744‚Üí        
   745‚Üí      } catch (error: any) {
   746‚Üí        lastError = error;
   747‚Üí        
   748‚Üí        if (this.isRateLimitError(error)) {
   749‚Üí          const backoffMs = Math.min(1000 * Math.pow(2, attempt), 30000); // Max 30 seconds
   750‚Üí          log(`Rate limited, retrying in ${backoffMs}ms`, 'warning', {
   751‚Üí            attempt: attempt + 1,
   752‚Üí            maxRetries,
   753‚Üí            status: error.status,
   754‚Üí            backoffMs
   755‚Üí          });
   756‚Üí          
   757‚Üí          if (attempt < maxRetries - 1) {
   758‚Üí            await this.sleep(backoffMs);
   759‚Üí            continue;
   760‚Üí          }
   761‚Üí        }
   762‚Üí        
   763‚Üí        // For non-rate-limit errors, don't retry
   764‚Üí        log(`OpenAI API call failed`, 'error', {
   765‚Üí          attempt: attempt + 1,
   766‚Üí          error: error.message,
   767‚Üí          status: error.status
   768‚Üí        });
   769‚Üí        break;
   770‚Üí      }
   771‚Üí    }
   772‚Üí    
   773‚Üí    throw lastError;
   774‚Üí  }
   775‚Üí
   776‚Üí  private buildAnalysisPrompt(
   777‚Üí    codeFiles: CodeFile[],
   778‚Üí    gitAnalysis: any,
   779‚Üí    vibeAnalysis: any,
   780‚Üí    crossAnalysis: any
   781‚Üí  ): string {
   782‚Üí    const codeOverview = codeFiles.slice(0, 5).map(file => ({
   783‚Üí      path: file.path,
   784‚Üí      language: file.language,
   785‚Üí      patterns: file.patterns,
   786‚Üí      functions: file.functions.slice(0, 5),
   787‚Üí      complexity: file.complexity
   788‚Üí    }));
   789‚Üí
   790‚Üí    return `Analyze this software development session and provide key insights:
   791‚Üí
   792‚ÜíCODE ANALYSIS:
   793‚Üí${JSON.stringify(codeOverview, null, 2)}
   794‚Üí
   795‚ÜíGIT CHANGES:
   796‚Üí- Commits: ${gitAnalysis?.commits?.length || 0}
   797‚Üí- Architectural decisions: ${gitAnalysis?.architecturalDecisions?.length || 0}
   798‚Üí- Code evolution patterns: ${gitAnalysis?.codeEvolution?.map((p: any) => p.pattern).join(', ') || 'None'}
   799‚Üí
   800‚ÜíCONVERSATION ANALYSIS:
   801‚Üí- Sessions: ${vibeAnalysis?.sessions?.length || 0}
   802‚Üí- Problem-solution pairs: ${vibeAnalysis?.problemSolutionPairs?.length || 0}
   803‚Üí- Main themes: ${vibeAnalysis?.patterns?.developmentThemes?.map((t: any) => t.theme).join(', ') || 'None'}
   804‚Üí
   805‚ÜíCROSS-ANALYSIS:
   806‚Üí${crossAnalysis.gitCodeCorrelation.join('\n')}
   807‚Üí${crossAnalysis.vibeCodeCorrelation.join('\n')}
   808‚Üí
   809‚ÜíPlease provide insights in JSON format:
   810‚Üí{
   811‚Üí  "keyPatterns": ["pattern1", "pattern2", ...],
   812‚Üí  "architecturalDecisions": ["decision1", "decision2", ...],
   813‚Üí  "technicalDebt": ["debt1", "debt2", ...],
   814‚Üí  "innovativeApproaches": ["approach1", "approach2", ...],
   815‚Üí  "learnings": ["learning1", "learning2", ...]
   816‚Üí}
   817‚Üí
   818‚ÜíFocus on:
   819‚Üí1. What architectural patterns are being used effectively
   820‚Üí2. What technical decisions show good engineering practices
   821‚Üí3. What areas need improvement or refactoring
   822‚Üí4. What innovative approaches were taken
   823‚Üí5. What can be learned for future development`;
   824‚Üí  }
   825‚Üí
   826‚Üí  private parseInsightsFromLLMResponse(response: string): SemanticAnalysisResult['semanticInsights'] {
   827‚Üí    try {
   828‚Üí      // Try to extract JSON from response
   829‚Üí      const jsonMatch = response.match(/\{[\s\S]*\}/);
   830‚Üí      if (jsonMatch) {
   831‚Üí        const parsed = JSON.parse(jsonMatch[0]);
   832‚Üí        return {
   833‚Üí          keyPatterns: parsed.keyPatterns || [],
   834‚Üí          architecturalDecisions: parsed.architecturalDecisions || [],
   835‚Üí          technicalDebt: parsed.technicalDebt || [],
   836‚Üí          innovativeApproaches: parsed.innovativeApproaches || [],
   837‚Üí          learnings: parsed.learnings || []
   838‚Üí        };
   839‚Üí      }
   840‚Üí    } catch (error) {
   841‚Üí      log('Failed to parse LLM response as JSON', 'warning', error);
   842‚Üí    }
   843‚Üí
   844‚Üí    // Fallback: extract insights from text
   845‚Üí    return {
   846‚Üí      keyPatterns: this.extractPatternFromText(response, 'pattern'),
   847‚Üí      architecturalDecisions: this.extractPatternFromText(response, 'decision|architecture'),
   848‚Üí      technicalDebt: this.extractPatternFromText(response, 'debt|improvement|refactor'),
   849‚Üí      innovativeApproaches: this.extractPatternFromText(response, 'innovative|creative|novel'),
   850‚Üí      learnings: this.extractPatternFromText(response, 'learning|insight|lesson')
   851‚Üí    };
   852‚Üí  }
   853‚Üí
   854‚Üí  private extractPatternFromText(text: string, pattern: string): string[] {
   855‚Üí    const regex = new RegExp(`(?:${pattern})[^.]*`, 'gi');
   856‚Üí    const matches = text.match(regex);
   857‚Üí    return matches ? matches.slice(0, 5) : [];
   858‚Üí  }
   859‚Üí
   860‚Üí  private generateRuleBasedInsights(
   861‚Üí    codeFiles: CodeFile[],
   862‚Üí    gitAnalysis: any,
   863‚Üí    vibeAnalysis: any,
   864‚Üí    crossAnalysis: any
   865‚Üí  ): SemanticAnalysisResult['semanticInsights'] {
   866‚Üí    // Extract insights from git analysis if available
   867‚Üí    const keyPatterns = codeFiles?.length > 0 
   868‚Üí      ? [...new Set(codeFiles.flatMap(f => f.patterns))]
   869‚Üí      : (gitAnalysis?.patterns || []).map((p: any) => p.name || p);
   870‚Üí    
   871‚Üí    const architecturalDecisions = gitAnalysis?.architecturalDecisions
   872‚Üí      ?.map((d: any) => `${d.type || 'Decision'}: ${d.description || d}`)
   873‚Üí      .slice(0, 5) || [];
   874‚Üí
   875‚Üí    // Get technical debt from code analysis or git commits
   876‚Üí    const technicalDebt = codeFiles?.length > 0
   877‚Üí      ? codeFiles.filter(f => f.complexity > 15)
   878‚Üí          .map(f => `High complexity in ${f.path} (${f.complexity})`).slice(0, 3)
   879‚Üí      : gitAnalysis?.commits?.filter((c: any) => c.message?.includes('fix') || c.message?.includes('refactor'))
   880‚Üí          .map((c: any) => `Technical fix: ${c.message?.substring(0, 50)}...`).slice(0, 3) || [];
   881‚Üí
   882‚Üí    // Generate insights from conversation analysis
   883‚Üí    const innovativeApproaches = crossAnalysis?.conversationImplementationMap?.length > 0
   884‚Üí      ? crossAnalysis.conversationImplementationMap
   885‚Üí          .map((m: any) => `Implemented ${m.implementation?.join(', ') || 'solution'} for: ${m.problem}`)
   886‚Üí          .slice(0, 3)
   887‚Üí      : vibeAnalysis?.sessions?.map((s: any) => `Development insight from session: ${s.content?.substring(0, 50)}...`).slice(0, 3) || [];
   888‚Üí
   889‚Üí    // Generate meaningful learnings even without code files
   890‚Üí    const learnings = [];
   891‚Üí    
   892‚Üí    if (codeFiles?.length > 0) {
   893‚Üí      learnings.push(`Primary development language: ${this.getMostUsedLanguage(codeFiles)}`);
   894‚Üí      learnings.push(`Code <USER_ID_REDACTED> score: ${this.calculateOverallQuality(codeFiles)}%`);
   895‚Üí    } else {
   896‚Üí      learnings.push(`Analysis based on git history with ${gitAnalysis?.commits?.length || 0} commits`);
   897‚Üí      learnings.push(`Repository contains ${gitAnalysis?.totalChanges || 0} total changes`);
   898‚Üí    }
   899‚Üí    
   900‚Üí    learnings.push(`Most common pattern: ${keyPatterns[0] || 'Pattern analysis in progress'}`);
   901‚Üí    
   902‚Üí    if (gitAnalysis?.summary) {
   903‚Üí      learnings.push(`Repository focus: ${gitAnalysis.summary}`);
   904‚Üí    }
   905‚Üí
   906‚Üí    log('Generated rule-based insights', 'info', {
   907‚Üí      keyPatterns: keyPatterns.length,
   908‚Üí      architecturalDecisions: architecturalDecisions.length,
   909‚Üí      technicalDebt: technicalDebt.length,
   910‚Üí      innovativeApproaches: innovativeApproaches.length,
   911‚Üí      learnings: learnings.length
   912‚Üí    });
   913‚Üí
   914‚Üí    return {
   915‚Üí      keyPatterns,
   916‚Üí      architecturalDecisions,
   917‚Üí      technicalDebt,
   918‚Üí      innovativeApproaches,
   919‚Üí      learnings
   920‚Üí    };
   921‚Üí  }
   922‚Üí
   923‚Üí  private getMostUsedLanguage(codeFiles: CodeFile[]): string {
   924‚Üí    const counts = new Map<string, number>();
   925‚Üí    codeFiles.forEach(file => {
   926‚Üí      counts.set(file.language, (counts.get(file.language) || 0) + 1);
   927‚Üí    });
   928‚Üí    
   929‚Üí    return Array.from(counts.entries())
   930‚Üí      .sort((a, b) => b[1] - a[1])[0]?.[0] || 'unknown';
   931‚Üí  }
   932‚Üí
   933‚Üí  private calculateOverallQuality(codeFiles: CodeFile[]): number {
   934‚Üí    const avgComplexity = codeFiles.reduce((sum, f) => sum + f.complexity, 0) / codeFiles.length;
   935‚Üí    const complexityScore = Math.max(0, 100 - (avgComplexity - 5) * 10);
   936‚Üí    
   937‚Üí    const patternScore = Math.min(100, codeFiles.flatMap(f => f.patterns).length * 10);
   938‚Üí    
   939‚Üí    return Math.round((complexityScore + patternScore) / 2);
   940‚Üí  }
   941‚Üí
   942‚Üí  private calculateConfidence(codeFiles: CodeFile[], crossAnalysis: any): number {
   943‚Üí    let confidence = 0.5; // Base confidence
   944‚Üí    
   945‚Üí    // More files analyzed = higher confidence
   946‚Üí    confidence += Math.min(0.3, codeFiles.length * 0.02);
   947‚Üí    
   948‚Üí    // Cross-analysis correlations increase confidence
   949‚Üí    confidence += Math.min(0.2, crossAnalysis.gitCodeCorrelation.length * 0.05);
   950‚Üí    confidence += Math.min(0.2, crossAnalysis.vibeCodeCorrelation.length * 0.05);
   951‚Üí    
   952‚Üí    return Math.min(1, confidence);
   953‚Üí  }
   954‚Üí
   955‚Üí  // Public wrapper methods for coordinator and tools compatibility
   956‚Üí  async analyzeSemantics(parameters: any): Promise<SemanticAnalysisResult> {
   957‚Üí    const { _context, incremental, git_analysis_results, vibe_analysis_results } = parameters;
   958‚Üí    
   959‚Üí    // Support both direct parameters and context-based parameters
   960‚Üí    const gitAnalysis = git_analysis_results || _context?.previousResults?.analyze_git_history;
   961‚Üí    const vibeAnalysis = vibe_analysis_results || _context?.previousResults?.analyze_vibe_history;

     4‚Üíexport type LogLevel = "debug" | "info" | "warning" | "error";
     5‚Üí
     6‚Üíinterface LogEntry {
     7‚Üí  timestamp: string;
     8‚Üí  level: LogLevel;
     9‚Üí  message: string;
    10‚Üí  data?: any;
    11‚Üí}
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üílet logDir: string = "";

    15‚Üí
    16‚Üíexport function setupLogging(): void {
    17‚Üí  // Create logs directory
    18‚Üí  logDir = path.join(process.cwd(), "logs");
    19‚Üí  if (!fs.existsSync(logDir)) {
    20‚Üí    fs.mkdirSync(logDir, { recursive: true });
    21‚Üí  }
    22‚Üí  
    23‚Üí  // Create log file with timestamp
    24‚Üí  const timestamp = new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0];
    25‚Üí  logFile = path.join(logDir, `semantic-analysis-${timestamp}.log`);
    26‚Üí  
    27‚Üí  log("Logging system initialized", "info");
    28‚Üí}
    29‚Üí
    30‚Üíexport function log(message: string, level: LogLevel = "info", data?: any): void {
    31‚Üí  const entry: LogEntry = {
    32‚Üí    timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
    33‚Üí    level,
    34‚Üí    message,
    35‚Üí    data
    36‚Üí  };
    37‚Üí  
    38‚Üí  // Write to stderr for debugging (visible in terminal)
    39‚Üí  console.error(`[${entry.timestamp}] ${level.toUpperCase()}: ${message}`);
    40‚Üí  if (data) {
    41‚Üí    console.error(`  Data: ${JSON.stringify(data, null, 2)}`);
    42‚Üí  }
    43‚Üí  
    44‚Üí  // Write to log file if initialized
    45‚Üí  if (logFile) {
    46‚Üí    try {
    47‚Üí      const logLine = JSON.stringify(entry) + '\n';
    48‚Üí      fs.appendFileSync(logFile, logLine);
    49‚Üí    } catch (error) {
    50‚Üí      console.error(`Failed to write to log file: ${error}`);
    51‚Üí    }
    52‚Üí  }
    53‚Üí}
    54‚Üí
    55‚Üíexport function logRequest(method: string, params: any): void {
    56‚Üí  log(`Request: ${method}`, "info", { params });
    57‚Üí}
    58‚Üí
    59‚Üíexport function logResponse(method: string, response: any): void {
    60‚Üí  log(`Response: ${method}`, "info", { response });
    61‚Üí}
    62‚Üí
    63‚Üíexport function logError(error: Error | string, context?: string): void {
    64‚Üí  const message = context ? `${context}: ${error}` : String(error);

    66‚Üí    name: error.name,

    68‚Üí    stack: error.stack
    69‚Üí  } : undefined);
    70‚Üí}

   122‚Üí  private detectProjectType(structuralFiles: string[]): RepositoryContext['projectType'] {
   123‚Üí    const fileSet = new Set(structuralFiles.map(f => path.basename(f)));
   124‚Üí    
   125‚Üí    // Check for specific project types
   126‚Üí    if (fileSet.has('package.json')) {
   127‚Üí      const packageJson = this.readJsonFile('package.json');
   128‚Üí      if (packageJson) {
   129‚Üí        // Check dependencies for clues
   130‚Üí        const allDeps = {
   131‚Üí          ...packageJson.dependencies || {},
   132‚Üí          ...packageJson.devDependencies || {}
   133‚Üí        };
   134‚Üí        
   135‚Üí        if (allDeps['react'] || allDeps['vue'] || allDeps['angular']) {
   136‚Üí          return 'web-app';
   137‚Üí        }
   138‚Üí        if (allDeps['express'] || allDeps['fastify'] || allDeps['koa']) {
   139‚Üí          return 'api';
   140‚Üí        }
   141‚Üí        if (packageJson.bin || allDeps['commander'] || allDeps['yargs']) {
   142‚Üí          return 'cli';
   143‚Üí        }
   144‚Üí        if (!packageJson.main && !packageJson.bin) {
   145‚Üí          return 'library';
   146‚Üí        }
   147‚Üí      }
   148‚Üí    }
   149‚Üí
   150‚Üí    if (fileSet.has('requirements.txt') || fileSet.has('pyproject.toml')) {
   151‚Üí      // Python project - analyze further
   152‚Üí      if (this.checkDirectoryExists('notebooks') || this.checkFilePatterns(['*.ipynb'])) {
   153‚Üí        return 'ml-pipeline';
   154‚Üí      }
   155‚Üí      if (this.checkDirectoryExists('api') || this.checkFilePatterns(['**/app.py', '**/main.py'])) {
   156‚Üí        return 'api';
   157‚Üí      }
   158‚Üí    }
   159‚Üí
   160‚Üí    if (fileSet.has('Cargo.toml')) {
   161‚Üí      const cargoToml = this.readTomlFile('Cargo.toml');
   162‚Üí      if (cargoToml?.bin) {
   163‚Üí        return 'cli';
   164‚Üí      }
   165‚Üí    }
   166‚Üí
   167‚Üí    // Fallback based on directory structure
   168‚Üí    if (this.checkDirectoryExists('src/components') || this.checkDirectoryExists('components')) {
   169‚Üí      return 'web-app';
   170‚Üí    }
   171‚Üí    if (this.checkDirectoryExists('routes') || this.checkDirectoryExists('controllers')) {
   172‚Üí      return 'api';
   173‚Üí    }
   174‚Üí    if (this.checkDirectoryExists('cmd') || this.checkDirectoryExists('cli')) {
   175‚Üí      return 'cli';
   176‚Üí    }
   177‚Üí
   178‚Üí    return 'unknown';
   179‚Üí  }

   181‚Üí  private detectPrimaryLanguages(): string[] {
   182‚Üí    const languages: Record<string, number> = {};
   183‚Üí    
   184‚Üí    const countFiles = (dir: string, extensions: string[], language: string) => {
   185‚Üí      try {
   186‚Üí        const files = this.getAllFiles(dir);
   187‚Üí        const count = files.filter(file => 
   188‚Üí          extensions.some(ext => file.endsWith(ext)) &&
   189‚Üí          !file.includes('node_modules') &&
   190‚Üí          !file.includes('.git') &&
   191‚Üí          !file.includes('dist') &&
   192‚Üí          !file.includes('build')
   193‚Üí        ).length;
   194‚Üí        if (count > 0) {
   195‚Üí          languages[language] = (languages[language] || 0) + count;
   196‚Üí          log(`Detected ${count} ${language} files in ${dir}`, 'debug');
   197‚Üí        }
   198‚Üí      } catch (error) {
   199‚Üí        log(`Failed to scan ${dir}: ${error}`, 'debug');
   200‚Üí      }
   201‚Üí    };
   202‚Üí
   203‚Üí    // Count files in both src/ and root directories for TypeScript/JavaScript
   204‚Üí    countFiles('src', ['.ts', '.tsx'], 'TypeScript');
   205‚Üí    countFiles('.', ['.ts', '.tsx'], 'TypeScript');
   206‚Üí    countFiles('src', ['.js', '.jsx'], 'JavaScript');  
   207‚Üí    countFiles('.', ['.js', '.jsx'], 'JavaScript');
   208‚Üí    
   209‚Üí    // Only count Python files in specific directories (exclude leftover experimental files)
   210‚Üí    countFiles('src', ['.py'], 'Python');
   211‚Üí    countFiles('lib', ['.py'], 'Python');
   212‚Üí    countFiles('app', ['.py'], 'Python');
   213‚Üí    
   214‚Üí    countFiles('src', ['.java'], 'Java');
   215‚Üí    countFiles('src', ['.rs'], 'Rust');
   216‚Üí    countFiles('src', ['.go'], 'Go');
   217‚Üí    countFiles('src', ['.cpp', '.cc', '.cxx'], 'C++');
   218‚Üí    countFiles('src', ['.c'], 'C');
   219‚Üí
   220‚Üí    const result = Object.entries(languages)
   221‚Üí      .sort(([,a], [,b]) => b - a)
   222‚Üí      .slice(0, 3)
   223‚Üí      .map(([lang]) => lang);
   224‚Üí      
   225‚Üí    log(`Language detection result: ${JSON.stringify(result)}`, 'info');
   226‚Üí    
   227‚Üí    if (result.length === 0) {
   228‚Üí      throw new Error('REPOSITORY_CONTEXT_ERROR: No primary languages detected - this should never happen');
   229‚Üí    }
   230‚Üí    
   231‚Üí    return result;
   232‚Üí  }
   233‚Üí
   234‚Üí  private detectFrameworks(structuralFiles: string[]): string[] {
   235‚Üí    const frameworks: string[] = [];
   236‚Üí    
   237‚Üí    // Check package.json
   238‚Üí    const packageJson = this.readJsonFile('package.json');
   239‚Üí    if (packageJson) {
   240‚Üí      const allDeps = {
   241‚Üí        ...packageJson.dependencies || {},
   242‚Üí        ...packageJson.devDependencies || {}
   243‚Üí      };
   244‚Üí      
   245‚Üí      const frameworkMap: Record<string, string> = {
   246‚Üí        'react': 'React',
   247‚Üí        'vue': 'Vue.js',
   248‚Üí        '@angular/core': 'Angular',
   249‚Üí        'express': 'Express.js',
   250‚Üí        'fastify': 'Fastify',
   251‚Üí        'koa': 'Koa.js',
   252‚Üí        'next': 'Next.js',
   253‚Üí        'nuxt': 'Nuxt.js',
   254‚Üí        'svelte': 'Svelte',
   255‚Üí        'jest': 'Jest',
   256‚Üí        'mocha': 'Mocha',
   257‚Üí        'cypress': 'Cypress',
   258‚Üí        'playwright': 'Playwright'
   259‚Üí      };
   260‚Üí      
   261‚Üí      Object.keys(allDeps).forEach(dep => {

   413‚Üí    if (Date.now() - context.lastUpdated.getTime() > maxAge) {
   414‚Üí      log('Context cache expired', 'info');

   437‚Üí    for (const file of structuralFiles) {

   439‚Üí      hasher.update(fileHash);

# Performance Analysis Report: Semantic Analysis MCP Server

## Performance Assessment

The semantic analysis MCP server exhibits several significant performance issues that impact scalability and resource utilization. The workflow execution took 142 seconds with several timeout utilization warnings, indicating both over-provisioned timeouts and potential processing inefficiencies.

## Critical Performance Issues (Ranked by Impact)

### 1. **Insight Generation Agent - Severe Bottleneck** (Critical Impact: 90% of total execution time)
**Root Cause**: The insight generation step consumed 128.5 seconds out of 142 total seconds, exceeding its 120-second timeout.

**Specific Issues**:
- **Synchronous LLM calls** without proper batching in `generateLLMInsights()` method
- **Multiple sequential file I/O operations** for PlantUML diagram generation
- **Large context building** in `buildAnalysisPrompt()` causing excessive token usage
- **Inefficient pattern matching** across all analyzed code files

**Performance Impact**: 
- 90% of workflow execution time
- Potential memory accumulation from large prompt contexts
- Risk of timeout failures in production

**Optimization Recommendations**:
```typescript
// Current inefficient approach
for (const pattern of significantPatterns) {
  const insightDoc = await this.generateInsightDocument(...);
  insightDocuments.push(insightDoc);
}

// Optimized batch processing approach
const batchSize = 3;

```

### 2. **File System I/O Operations - Memory and Performance Leak** (High Impact)
**Root Cause**: Synchronous file operations throughout the codebase causing blocking behavior.

**Specific Issues**:
- `fs.readFileSync()` and `fs.writeFileSync()` in `analyzeCodeFiles()` and logging
- **No file size limits** before reading (files > 1MB skipped but still stat'd)
- **Synchronous directory creation** in multiple agents
- **Unbounded log file growth** in logging.ts

**Code Examples**:
```typescript
// Problem: Synchronous file operations
const content = fs.readFileSync(fullPath, 'utf8'); // BLOCKING

// Solution: Async with proper error handling

```

### 3. **Memory Accumulation in Coordinator Agent** (High Impact)
**Root Cause**: Executions map grows unbounded and workflow results are deeply nested objects.

**Specific Issues**:
- **Unbounded execution history** (only cleaned after 100 executions)
- **Deep object nesting** in execution results without memory release
- **Parameter template resolution** creates object copies without cleanup
- **Background monitor runs every 30 seconds** but doesn't release old data effectively

**Memory Growth Pattern**:
```typescript
// Current problematic pattern
this.executions.set(executionId, execution); // Never cleaned until 100+ executions
execution.results[stepName] = {
  ...stepResult, // Deep nested objects
  _timing: { /* more objects */ },
  _parameters: { /* potential circular references */ }
};
```

### 4. **Inefficient LLM API Utilization** (Medium Impact)
**Root Cause**: Multiple sequential API calls with inadequate batching and poor error recovery.

**Specific Issues**:
- **Exponential backoff without intelligent circuit breaking**
- **Large prompt contexts** (5+ files in buildAnalysisPrompt)
- **No request caching** for similar analysis patterns
- **Redundant API calls** across different agents for same content

### 5. **Pattern Detection Algorithm Complexity** (Medium Impact)
**Root Cause**: O(n*m) complexity for pattern matching across files and patterns.

**Specific Issues**:
- **Regex compilation on every file** in `detectCodePatterns()`
- **Nested loops** for pattern matching without indexing
- **String operations** on large file contents without streaming

## Algorithmic Improvements

### 1. **Batch Processing for I/O Operations**
Replace sequential file processing with concurrent batched operations:

```typescript
// Current: O(n) sequential processing
for (const filePath of filePaths) {
  const codeFile = await this.analyzeCodeFile(filePath);
  codeFiles.push(codeFile);
}

// Optimized: Concurrent batched processing
const batchSize = 10;
const batches = chunk(filePaths, batchSize);
const allCodeFiles = await Promise.all(
  batches.map(batch => 
    Promise.all(batch.map(path => this.analyzeCodeFile(path)))
  )
).then(results => results.flat());
```

### 2. **Memory-Efficient Result Storage**
Implement result streaming and cleanup:

```typescript
// Add to coordinator agent
private cleanupExecutionData(execution: WorkflowExecution): void {
  // Remove large nested objects after persistence
  Object.keys(execution.results).forEach(stepName => {
    if (execution.results[stepName]._rawData) {
      delete execution.results[stepName]._rawData;
    }
  });
}
```

### 3. **Intelligent Caching Strategy**
Add memoization for expensive operations:

```typescript
// Cache pattern detection results
private patternCache = new Map<string, string[]>();

private detectCodePatterns(content: string, language: string): string[] {
  const cacheKey = `${language}:${this.hashContent(content)}`;
  if (this.patternCache.has(cacheKey)) {
    return this.patternCache.get(cacheKey)!;
  }
  
  const patterns = this.computePatterns(content, language);
  this.patternCache.set(cacheKey, patterns);
  return patterns;
}
```

     1‚Üíimport { Server } from "@modelcontextprotocol/sdk/server/index.js";
     2‚Üíimport {
     3‚Üí  CallToolRequestSchema,
     4‚Üí  ListToolsRequestSchema,
     5‚Üí} from "@modelcontextprotocol/sdk/types.js";
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üíimport { log, logRequest, logResponse, logError } from "./logging.js";
     8‚Üíimport { TOOLS, handleToolCall } from "./tools.js";
     9‚Üí
    10‚Üíexport function createServer() {
    11‚Üí  const server = new Server(
    12‚Üí    {
    13‚Üí      name: "semantic-analysis",
    14‚Üí      version: "1.0.0",
    15‚Üí    },
    16‚Üí    {
    17‚Üí      capabilities: {
    18‚Üí        tools: {},
    19‚Üí        logging: {},
    20‚Üí      },
    21‚Üí    }
    22‚Üí  );
    23‚Üí
    24‚Üí  // Setup request handlers
    25‚Üí  server.setRequestHandler(ListToolsRequestSchema, async (request) => {
    26‚Üí    try {
    27‚Üí      logRequest("ListTools", request.params);
    28‚Üí      const response = { tools: TOOLS };
    29‚Üí      logResponse("ListTools", response);
    30‚Üí      return response;
    31‚Üí    } catch (error) {
    32‚Üí      logError(error instanceof Error ? error : new Error(String(error)), "ListTools");
    33‚Üí      return {
    34‚Üí        error: {
    35‚Üí          code: -32603,
    36‚Üí          message: `Internal error: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`,
    37‚Üí        },
    38‚Üí      };
    39‚Üí    }
    40‚Üí  });
    41‚Üí
    42‚Üí  server.setRequestHandler(CallToolRequestSchema, async (request) => {
    43‚Üí    try {
    44‚Üí      logRequest("CallTool", request.params);
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí      if (!request.params?.name || !TOOLS.find((t) => t.name === request.params.name)) {
    47‚Üí        throw new Error(`Invalid tool name: ${request.params?.name}`);
    48‚Üí      }
    49‚Üí
    50‚Üí      const result = await handleToolCall(
    51‚Üí        request.params.name,
    52‚Üí        request.params.arguments ?? {}
    53‚Üí      );
    54‚Üí
    55‚Üí      logResponse("CallTool", result);
    56‚Üí      return result;
    57‚Üí    } catch (error) {
    58‚Üí      logError(error instanceof Error ? error : new Error(String(error)), "CallTool");
    59‚Üí      return {
    60‚Üí        error: {
    61‚Üí          code: -32603,
    62‚Üí          message: `Internal error: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`,
    63‚Üí        },
    64‚Üí      };
    65‚Üí    }
    66‚Üí  });
    67‚Üí
    68‚Üí  return server;
    69‚Üí}

   375‚Üí  async executeWorkflow(workflowName: string, parameters: Record<string, any> = {}): Promise<WorkflowExecution> {
   376‚Üí    const workflow = this.workflows.get(workflowName);
   377‚Üí    if (!workflow) {
   378‚Üí      throw new Error(`Unknown workflow: ${workflowName}`);
   379‚Üí    }
   380‚Üí
   381‚Üí    const executionId = `${workflowName}-${Date.now()}`;
   382‚Üí    const execution: WorkflowExecution = {
   383‚Üí      id: executionId,
   384‚Üí      workflow: workflowName,
   385‚Üí      status: "pending",
   386‚Üí      startTime: new Date(),
   387‚Üí      results: {},
   388‚Üí      errors: [],
   389‚Üí      currentStep: 0,
   390‚Üí      totalSteps: workflow.steps.length,
   391‚Üí    };
   392‚Üí
   393‚Üí    this.executions.set(executionId, execution);
   394‚Üí
   395‚Üí    log(`Starting workflow execution: ${executionId}`, "info", {
   396‚Üí      workflow: workflowName,
   397‚Üí      parameters,
   398‚Üí      totalSteps: workflow.steps.length,
   399‚Üí    });
   400‚Üí
   401‚Üí    try {
   402‚Üí      execution.status = "running";
   403‚Üí      
   404‚Üí      // Execute workflow steps
   405‚Üí      for (let i = 0; i < workflow.steps.length; i++) {
   406‚Üí        execution.currentStep = i;
   407‚Üí        const step = workflow.steps[i];
   408‚Üí        
   409‚Üí        // Check dependencies
   410‚Üí        if (step.dependencies) {
   411‚Üí          for (const dep of step.dependencies) {
   412‚Üí            if (!execution.results[dep] || execution.results[dep].error) {
   413‚Üí              throw new Error(`Step dependency not satisfied: ${dep}`);
   414‚Üí            }
   415‚Üí          }
   416‚Üí        }
   417‚Üí        
   418‚Üí        // Execute step with timing tracking
   419‚Üí        const stepStartTime = new Date();
   420‚Üí        try {
   421‚Üí          const stepResult = await this.executeStepWithTimeout(execution, step, parameters);
   422‚Üí          const stepEndTime = new Date();
   423‚Üí          const stepDuration = stepEndTime.getTime() - stepStartTime.getTime();
   424‚Üí          
   425‚Üí          // Store timing information with result
   426‚Üí          execution.results[step.name] = {
   427‚Üí            ...stepResult,
   428‚Üí            _timing: {
   429‚Üí              startTime: stepStartTime,
   430‚Üí              endTime: stepEndTime,
   431‚Üí              duration: stepDuration,
   432‚Üí              timeout: step.timeout || 60
   433‚Üí            }
   434‚Üí          };
   435‚Üí          
   436‚Üí          log(`Step completed: ${step.name}`, "info", {
   437‚Üí            step: step.name,
   438‚Üí            agent: step.agent,
   439‚Üí            hasResult: !!stepResult,
   440‚Üí            duration: `${(stepDuration / 1000).toFixed(1)}s`,
   441‚Üí            timeoutUtilization: `${((stepDuration / 1000) / (step.timeout || 60) * 100).toFixed(1)}%`
   442‚Üí          });
   443‚Üí
   444‚Üí          // QA Enforcement: Check <USER_ID_REDACTED> assurance results and implement retry logic
   445‚Üí          if (step.name === 'quality_assurance' && stepResult) {
   446‚Üí            const qaFailures = this.validateQualityAssuranceResults(stepResult);
   447‚Üí            if (qaFailures.length > 0) {
   448‚Üí              log(`QA Enforcement: <USER_ID_REDACTED> issues detected, attempting intelligent retry`, "warning", {
   449‚Üí                failures: qaFailures,
   450‚Üí                step: step.name,
   451‚Üí                workflow: execution.workflow
   452‚Üí              });
   453‚Üí              
   454‚Üí              // Attempt to fix the issues by retrying failed steps with enhanced parameters
   455‚Üí              const retryResult = await this.attemptQARecovery(qaFailures, execution, workflow);
   456‚Üí              
   457‚Üí              if (!retryResult.success) {
   458‚Üí                const <USER_ID_REDACTED> = `<USER_ID_REDACTED> Assurance failed after retry with ${retryResult.remainingFailures.length} critical issues: ${retryResult.remainingFailures.join(', ')}`;
   459‚Üí                log(`QA Enforcement: Halting workflow after retry attempt`, "error", {
   460‚Üí                  failures: retryResult.remainingFailures,
   461‚Üí                  step: step.name,
   462‚Üí                  workflow: execution.workflow
   463‚Üí                });
   464‚Üí                throw new Error(<USER_ID_REDACTED>);
   465‚Üí              }
   466‚Üí              
   467‚Üí              log(`QA Enforcement: <USER_ID_REDACTED> validation passed after retry`, "info");
   468‚Üí            } else {
   469‚Üí              log(`QA Enforcement: <USER_ID_REDACTED> validation passed`, "info");
   470‚Üí            }
   471‚Üí          }
   472‚Üí          
   473‚Üí        } catch (error) {
   474‚Üí          const errorMessage = error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error);
   475‚Üí          execution.results[step.name] = { error: errorMessage };
   476‚Üí          execution.errors.push(`Step ${step.name} failed: ${errorMessage}`);
   477‚Üí          
   478‚Üí          log(`Step failed: ${step.name}`, "error", {
   479‚Üí            step: step.name,
   480‚Üí            agent: step.agent,
   481‚Üí            error: errorMessage
   482‚Üí          });
   483‚Üí          
   484‚Üí          // Stop workflow on step failure
   485‚Üí          throw error;
   486‚Üí        }
   487‚Üí      }
   488‚Üí
   489‚Üí      execution.status = "completed";
   490‚Üí      execution.endTime = new Date();
   491‚Üí      
   492‚Üí      // Save successful workflow completion checkpoint
   493‚Üí      try {
   494‚Üí        const persistenceAgent = this.agents.get('persistence') as PersistenceAgent;
   495‚Üí        if (persistenceAgent && persistenceAgent.saveSuccessfulWorkflowCompletion) {
   496‚Üí          await persistenceAgent.saveSuccessfulWorkflowCompletion(workflowName, execution.endTime);
   497‚Üí          log('Workflow completion checkpoint saved', 'info', { workflow: workflowName });
   498‚Üí        }
   499‚Üí      } catch (checkpointError) {
   500‚Üí        log('Failed to save workflow completion checkpoint', 'warning', checkpointError);
   501‚Üí        // Don't fail the workflow for checkpoint issues
   502‚Üí      }
   503‚Üí      
   504‚Üí      // Generate summary with enhanced timing analysis
   505‚Üí      const summary = this.generateWorkflowSummary(execution, workflow);
   506‚Üí      const performanceMetrics = this.analyzeWorkflowPerformance(execution);
   507‚Üí      
   508‚Üí      log(`Workflow completed: ${executionId}`, "info", {
   509‚Üí        duration: execution.endTime.getTime() - execution.startTime.getTime(),
   510‚Üí        stepsCompleted: execution.currentStep + 1,
   511‚Üí        performanceScore: performanceMetrics.overallScore,
   512‚Üí        bottlenecks: performanceMetrics.bottlenecks,
   513‚Üí        summary
   514‚Üí      });
   515‚Üí      
   516‚Üí    } catch (error) {
   517‚Üí      execution.status = "failed";
   518‚Üí      execution.endTime = new Date();
   519‚Üí      execution.errors.push(error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error));
   520‚Üí      
   521‚Üí      // ROLLBACK: Attempt to rollback changes if critical failure occurred
   522‚Üí      if (execution.rollbackActions && execution.rollbackActions.length > 0) {
   523‚Üí        log(`Attempting rollback due to workflow failure: ${executionId}`, "warning", {
   524‚Üí          rollbackActionsCount: execution.rollbackActions.length,
   525‚Üí          error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
   526‚Üí        });
   527‚Üí        
   528‚Üí        try {
   529‚Üí          await this.performRollback(execution);
   530‚Üí          execution.rolledBack = true;
   531‚Üí          log(`Rollback completed successfully for: ${executionId}`, "info");
   532‚Üí        } catch (rollbackError) {
   533‚Üí          log(`Rollback failed for: ${executionId}`, "error", rollbackError);
   534‚Üí          execution.errors.push(`Rollback failed: ${rollbackError instanceof Error ? rollbackError.message : String(rollbackError)}`);
   535‚Üí        }
   536‚Üí      }
   537‚Üí      
   538‚Üí      log(`Workflow failed: ${executionId}`, "error", {
   539‚Üí        error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error),
   540‚Üí        currentStep: execution.currentStep,
   541‚Üí        duration: execution.endTime.getTime() - execution.startTime.getTime(),
   542‚Üí        rolledBack: execution.rolledBack || false
   543‚Üí      });
   544‚Üí    }
   545‚Üí
   546‚Üí    return execution;
   547‚Üí  }
   548‚Üí
   549‚Üí  private async executeStepWithTimeout(
   550‚Üí    execution: WorkflowExecution,
   551‚Üí    step: WorkflowStep,
   552‚Üí    globalParams: Record<string, any>
   553‚Üí  ): Promise<any> {
   554‚Üí    log(`Executing step: ${step.name}`, "info", {
   555‚Üí      agent: step.agent,
   556‚Üí      action: step.action,
   557‚Üí      timeout: step.timeout || 60,
   558‚Üí    });
   559‚Üí
   560‚Üí    const stepTimeout = (step.timeout || 60) * 1000;
   561‚Üí    const stepParams = { ...step.parameters, ...globalParams };
   562‚Üí
   563‚Üí    // Resolve template placeholders in parameters
   564‚Üí    this.resolveParameterTemplates(stepParams, execution.results);
   565‚Üí
   566‚Üí    // Add execution context
   567‚Üí    stepParams._context = {
   568‚Üí      workflow: execution.workflow,
   569‚Üí      executionId: execution.id,
   570‚Üí      previousResults: execution.results,
   571‚Üí      step: step.name
   572‚Üí    };
   573‚Üí
   574‚Üí    const timeoutPromise = new Promise((_, reject) => {
   575‚Üí      setTimeout(() => reject(new Error(`Step timeout after ${step.timeout || 60}s`)), stepTimeout);
   576‚Üí    });
   577‚Üí
   578‚Üí    const executionPromise = this.executeStepOperation(step, stepParams, execution);
   579‚Üí
   580‚Üí    try {
   581‚Üí      return await Promise.race([executionPromise, timeoutPromise]);
   582‚Üí    } catch (error) {
   583‚Üí      log(`Step failed: ${step.name}`, "error", {
   584‚Üí        agent: step.agent,
   585‚Üí        action: step.action,
   586‚Üí        error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error),
   587‚Üí      });
   588‚Üí      throw error;
   589‚Üí    }
   590‚Üí  }
   591‚Üí
   592‚Üí  private async executeStepOperation(step: WorkflowStep, parameters: Record<string, any>, execution: WorkflowExecution): Promise<any> {
   593‚Üí    const agent = this.agents.get(step.agent);
   594‚Üí    
   595‚Üí    if (!agent) {
   596‚Üí      const error = `Agent not found: ${step.agent}. Available agents: ${Array.from(this.agents.keys()).join(', ')}`;
   597‚Üí      log(error, "error");
   598‚Üí      throw new Error(error);
   599‚Üí    }
   600‚Üí
   601‚Üí    if (typeof agent[step.action] !== 'function') {
   602‚Üí      const availableMethods = Object.getOwnPropertyNames(Object.getPrototypeOf(agent))
   603‚Üí        .filter(name => typeof agent[name] === 'function' && name !== 'constructor');
   604‚Üí      const error = `Action ${step.action} not found on agent ${step.agent}. Available methods: ${availableMethods.join(', ')}`;
   605‚Üí      log(error, "error");
   606‚Üí      throw new Error(error);
   607‚Üí    }
   608‚Üí
   609‚Üí    try {
   610‚Üí      log(`Executing agent method: ${step.agent}.${step.action}`, "info", {
   611‚Üí        agent: step.agent,
   612‚Üí        action: step.action,
   613‚Üí        parameters: Object.keys(parameters)
   614‚Üí      });
   615‚Üí      
   616‚Üí      const result = await agent[step.action](parameters);
   617‚Üí      
   618‚Üí      log(`Agent method completed: ${step.agent}.${step.action}`, "info", {
   619‚Üí        resultType: typeof result,
   620‚Üí        hasResult: !!result
   621‚Üí      });
   622‚Üí      
   623‚Üí      return result;
   624‚Üí      
   625‚Üí    } catch (error) {
   626‚Üí      log(`Agent method failed: ${step.agent}.${step.action}`, "error", {
   627‚Üí        agent: step.agent,
   628‚Üí        action: step.action,
   629‚Üí        error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error),
   630‚Üí        stack: error instanceof Error ? error.stack : undefined
   631‚Üí      });
   632‚Üí      throw error;
   633‚Üí    }
   634‚Üí  }
   635‚Üí
   636‚Üí  /**
   637‚Üí   * Resolve template placeholders in parameters like {{step_name.result}}
   638‚Üí   */
   639‚Üí  private resolveParameterTemplates(parameters: Record<string, any>, results: Record<string, any>): void {
   640‚Üí    for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(parameters)) {
   641‚Üí      if (typeof value === 'string' && value.startsWith('{{') && value.endsWith('}}')) {
   642‚Üí        const template = value.slice(2, -2); // Remove {{ and }}
   643‚Üí        const [stepName, property = 'result'] = template.split('.');
   644‚Üí        
   645‚Üí        if (results[stepName] && !results[stepName].error) {
   646‚Üí          const resolvedValue = property === 'result' ? results[stepName] : results[stepName][property];
   647‚Üí          parameters[key] = resolvedValue;
   648‚Üí          
   649‚Üí          log(`Resolved template: ${value} -> ${typeof resolvedValue}`, "debug", {
   650‚Üí            template: value,
   651‚Üí            stepName,
   652‚Üí            property,
   653‚Üí            resolvedType: typeof resolvedValue
   654‚Üí          });
   655‚Üí        } else {
   656‚Üí          log(`Failed to resolve template: ${value} - step not found or failed`, "warning", {
   657‚Üí            template: value,
   658‚Üí            stepName,
   659‚Üí            availableSteps: Object.keys(results)
   660‚Üí          });
   661‚Üí          parameters[key] = null;
   662‚Üí        }
   663‚Üí      } else if (typeof value === 'object' && value !== null) {
   664‚Üí        // Recursively resolve nested objects
   665‚Üí        this.resolveParameterTemplates(value, results);
   666‚Üí      }
   667‚Üí    }
   668‚Üí  }
   669‚Üí
   670‚Üí  /**
   671‚Üí   * Perform rollback of workflow changes
   672‚Üí   */
   673‚Üí  private async performRollback(execution: WorkflowExecution): Promise<void> {
   674‚Üí    if (!execution.rollbackActions) return;
   675‚Üí    
   676‚Üí    // Reverse order rollback (last actions first)
   677‚Üí    const reversedActions = [...execution.rollbackActions].reverse();
   678‚Üí    
   679‚Üí    for (const action of reversedActions) {
   680‚Üí      try {
   681‚Üí        switch (action.type) {
   682‚Üí          case 'file_created':
   683‚Üí            // Remove created file
   684‚Üí            if (fs.existsSync(action.target)) {
   685‚Üí              fs.unlinkSync(action.target);
   686‚Üí              log(`Rollback: Removed created file ${action.target}`, 'info');
   687‚Üí            }
   688‚Üí            break;
   689‚Üí            
   690‚Üí          case 'file_modified':
   691‚Üí            // Restore original file content
   692‚Üí            if (action.originalState) {
   693‚Üí              fs.writeFileSync(action.target, action.originalState, 'utf8');
   694‚Üí              log(`Rollback: Restored file ${action.target}`, 'info');
   695‚Üí            }
   696‚Üí            break;
   697‚Üí            
   698‚Üí          case 'entity_created':
   699‚Üí            // Remove entity from shared memory (requires persistence agent)
   700‚Üí            const persistenceAgent = this.agents.get('persistence');
   701‚Üí            if (persistenceAgent && typeof persistenceAgent.removeEntity === 'function') {
   702‚Üí              await persistenceAgent.removeEntity(action.target);
   703‚Üí              log(`Rollback: Removed entity ${action.target}`, 'info');
   704‚Üí            }
   705‚Üí            break;
   706‚Üí        }
   707‚Üí      } catch (rollbackError) {
   708‚Üí        log(`Rollback action failed for ${action.type}:${action.target}`, 'error', rollbackError);
   709‚Üí        // Continue with other rollback actions even if one fails
   710‚Üí      }
   711‚Üí    }
   712‚Üí  }
   713‚Üí
   714‚Üí  /**
   715‚Üí   * Validate <USER_ID_REDACTED> Assurance results and return critical failures
   716‚Üí   */
   717‚Üí  private validateQualityAssuranceResults(qaResult: any): string[] {
   718‚Üí    const criticalFailures: string[] = [];
   719‚Üí    
   720‚Üí    if (!qaResult || !qaResult.validations) {
   721‚Üí      criticalFailures.push("No QA validations found");
   722‚Üí      return criticalFailures;
   723‚Üí    }
   724‚Üí
   725‚Üí    // Check each step's QA validation
   726‚Üí    for (const [stepName, validation] of Object.entries(qaResult.validations)) {
   727‚Üí      const val = validation as any;
   728‚Üí      
   729‚Üí      // Critical failure conditions
   730‚Üí      if (!val.passed) {
   731‚Üí        if (val.errors && val.errors.length > 0) {
   732‚Üí          // Focus on specific critical errors
   733‚Üí          const criticalErrors = val.errors.filter((error: string) => 
   734‚Üí            error.includes('Missing insights') || 
   735‚Üí            error.includes('phantom node') ||
   736‚Üí            error.includes('file not found') ||
   737‚Üí            error.includes('broken filename')
   738‚Üí          );
   739‚Üí          if (criticalErrors.length > 0) {
   740‚Üí            criticalFailures.push(`${stepName}: ${criticalErrors.join(', ')}`);
   741‚Üí          }
   742‚Üí        }
   743‚Üí        
   744‚Üí        // Check <USER_ID_REDACTED> score threshold
   745‚Üí        if (val.score !== undefined && val.score < 60) {
   746‚Üí          criticalFailures.push(`${stepName}: <USER_ID_REDACTED> score too low (${val.score}/100)`);
   747‚Üí        }
   748‚Üí      }
   749‚Üí    }
   750‚Üí
   751‚Üí    // Overall QA score check
   752‚Üí    if (qaResult.overallScore !== undefined && qaResult.overallScore < 70) {
   753‚Üí      criticalFailures.push(`Overall QA score below threshold (${qaResult.overallScore}/100)`);
   754‚Üí    }
   755‚Üí
   756‚Üí    return criticalFailures;
   757‚Üí  }

   759‚Üí  /**
   760‚Üí   * Attempt to recover from QA failures by retrying failed steps with enhanced parameters
   761‚Üí   */
   762‚Üí  private async attemptQARecovery(
   763‚Üí    failures: string[],
   764‚Üí    execution: WorkflowExecution,
   765‚Üí    workflow: WorkflowDefinition
   766‚Üí  ): Promise<{ success: boolean; remainingFailures: string[] }> {
   767‚Üí    log('Attempting QA recovery', 'info', { failures });
   768‚Üí    
   769‚Üí    const remainingFailures: string[] = [];
   770‚Üí    const failedSteps = new Set<string>();
   771‚Üí    
   772‚Üí    // Identify which steps need retry based on failures
   773‚Üí    failures.forEach(failure => {
   774‚Üí      const [stepName] = failure.split(':');
   775‚Üí      if (stepName) {
   776‚Üí        failedSteps.add(stepName.trim());
   777‚Üí      }
   778‚Üí    });
   779‚Üí    
   780‚Üí    // Retry each failed step with enhanced parameters
   781‚Üí    for (const stepName of failedSteps) {
   782‚Üí      const step = workflow.steps.find(s => s.name === stepName);
   783‚Üí      if (!step) continue;
   784‚Üí      
   785‚Üí      try {
   786‚Üí        log(`Retrying step ${stepName} with enhanced parameters`, 'info');
   787‚Üí        
   788‚Üí        // Build enhanced parameters based on the failure type
   789‚Üí        const enhancedParams = this.buildEnhancedParameters(stepName, failures, execution);
   790‚Üí        
   791‚Üí        // Get the agent and retry the action
   792‚Üí        const agent = this.agents.get(step.agent);
   793‚Üí        if (!agent) {
   794‚Üí          throw new Error(`Agent ${step.agent} not found`);
   795‚Üí        }
   796‚Üí        
   797‚Üí        const action = (agent as any)[step.action];
   798‚Üí        if (!action) {
   799‚Üí          throw new Error(`Action ${step.action} not found on agent ${step.agent}`);
   800‚Üí        }
   801‚Üí        
   802‚Üí        // Retry with enhanced parameters
   803‚Üí        const retryResult = await action.call(agent, enhancedParams);
   804‚Üí        
   805‚Üí        // Update execution results
   806‚Üí        execution.results[stepName] = retryResult;
   807‚Üí        
   808‚Üí        log(`Successfully retried step ${stepName}`, 'info');
   809‚Üí        
   810‚Üí      } catch (retryError) {
   811‚Üí        const errorMsg = retryError instanceof Error ? retryError.message : String(retryError);
   812‚Üí        remainingFailures.push(`${stepName}: ${errorMsg} (after retry)`);
   813‚Üí        log(`Failed to retry step ${stepName}`, 'error', { error: errorMsg });
   814‚Üí      }
   815‚Üí    }
   816‚Üí    
   817‚Üí    // Re-run QA to check if issues are resolved
   818‚Üí    if (remainingFailures.length === 0) {
   819‚Üí      try {
   820‚Üí        const qaStep = workflow.steps.find(s => s.name === 'quality_assurance');
   821‚Üí        if (qaStep) {
   822‚Üí          const <USER_ID_REDACTED> = this.agents.get(qaStep.agent);
   823‚Üí          if (<USER_ID_REDACTED>) {
   824‚Üí            const qaAction = (<USER_ID_REDACTED> as any)[qaStep.action];
   825‚Üí            if (qaAction) {
   826‚Üí              const qaParams = { ...qaStep.parameters };
   827‚Üí              this.resolveParameterTemplates(qaParams, execution.results);
   828‚Üí              qaParams._context = {
   829‚Üí                workflow: execution.workflow,
   830‚Üí                executionId: execution.id,
   831‚Üí                previousResults: execution.results,
   832‚Üí                step: qaStep.name
   833‚Üí              };
   834‚Üí              const newQaResult = await qaAction.call(<USER_ID_REDACTED>, qaParams);
   835‚Üí              
   836‚Üí              // Validate the new QA results
   837‚Üí              const newFailures = this.validateQualityAssuranceResults(newQaResult);
   838‚Üí              if (newFailures.length > 0) {
   839‚Üí                remainingFailures.push(...newFailures);
   840‚Üí              }
   841‚Üí            }
   842‚Üí          }
   843‚Üí        }
   844‚Üí      } catch (<USER_ID_REDACTED>) {
   845‚Üí        log('Failed to re-run QA after retry', 'error', <USER_ID_REDACTED>);
   846‚Üí      }
   847‚Üí    }
   848‚Üí    
   849‚Üí    return {
   850‚Üí      success: remainingFailures.length === 0,
   851‚Üí      remainingFailures
   852‚Üí    };
   853‚Üí  }

   855‚Üí  /**
   856‚Üí   * Build enhanced parameters for retry based on failure analysis
   857‚Üí   */
   858‚Üí  private buildEnhancedParameters(
   859‚Üí    stepName: string,
   860‚Üí    failures: string[],
   861‚Üí    execution: WorkflowExecution
   862‚Üí  ): any {
   863‚Üí    const baseParams = execution.results[stepName]?._parameters || {};
   864‚Üí    const enhancedParams = { ...baseParams };
   865‚Üí    
   866‚Üí    // Analyze failures to determine enhancement strategy
   867‚Üí    const stepFailures = failures.filter(f => f.startsWith(`${stepName}:`));
   868‚Üí    
   869‚Üí    if (stepName === 'semantic_analysis') {
   870‚Üí      // If semantic analysis failed due to missing insights, enhance the analysis depth
   871‚Üí      if (stepFailures.some(f => f.includes('Missing insights'))) {
   872‚Üí        enhancedParams.analysisDepth = 'comprehensive';
   873‚Üí        enhancedParams.includeDetailedInsights = true;
   874‚Üí        enhancedParams.minInsightLength = 200;
   875‚Üí      }
   876‚Üí    } else if (stepName === 'insight_generation') {
   877‚Üí      // If insight generation failed, request more detailed insights
   878‚Üí      enhancedParams.generateDetailedInsights = true;
   879‚Üí      enhancedParams.includeCodeExamples = true;
   880‚Üí      enhancedParams.minPatternSignificance = 5;
   881‚Üí    } else if (stepName === 'web_search') {
   882‚Üí      // If web search failed, try with broader search parameters
   883‚Üí      enhancedParams.searchDepth = 'comprehensive';
   884‚Üí      enhancedParams.includeAlternativePatterns = true;
   885‚Üí    }
   886‚Üí    
   887‚Üí    // Add retry context to help agents understand they're in a retry
   888‚Üí    enhancedParams._retryContext = {
   889‚Üí      isRetry: true,
   890‚Üí      previousFailures: stepFailures,
   891‚Üí      enhancementReason: 'QA validation failure'
   892‚Üí    };
   893‚Üí    
   894‚Üí    return enhancedParams;
   895‚Üí  }
